mxCell.value: This app is going to look really complicated, but at its core it is going to be straightforward to build
Our focus is going to be on React/Redux, not any complicated backend pieces
React app that can create and browse streams
Web server that knows which streams are currently broadcasting
Are you sure you want to delete this stream?
Every user has one stream/channel they can stream to
Every user can create unlimited channels/streams that they can stream to
User can view a list of all streams/channels
User can view video for a single stream
User is logged in
User can create a new stream/channel
User can edit a stream/channel they have created
User can delete a stream/channel they have created
Need to be able to navigate around to separate pages in our app
Need to allow a user to login/logout
Need to handle forms in Redux
Need to master CRUD (Create Read Update Destroy) operations in React/Redux
Errors will likely occur!  Need good error handling
Core navigation lib - we don't install this manually
Navigation for dom-based apps (we want this!)
Bindings between Redux and React Router (not necessary)
BrowserRouter communicates the URL down to all Route components
Each Route decides to show or hide itself based on the URL
Keeps track of the address bar in your browser
Listens to 'history' for changes to the URL
Visible only when the 'path' matches the current URL
You add an <a /> tag to your application with href='/pagetwo' and click it
Your browser makes a request to localhost:3000/pagetwo
Development server responds with index.html file
Browser receives index.html file, dumps old HTML file it was showing (including all of your React/Redux state data!)
index.html file lists our JS files in script tags - browser downloads and executes these scripts
User wants to navigate to another page in our app
'History' sees updated URL, takes URL and sends it to BrowserRouter
BrowserRouter communicates the URL to Route components
Route components rerender to show new set of components
React Router prevents the browser from navigating to the new page and fetching new index.html file!
Uses everything after the TLD (.com, .net) or port as the 'path'
Uses everything after a # as the 'path'
Doesn't use the URL to track navigation
I'm looking for content for the route '/pageone'
Do I have a route for /pageone?
Yes, I am supposed to generate some HTML send it back
I'm looking for content for the route '/pagetwo'
I don't know what route that is, so here's a 404!
Do I have a route for /pagetwo?
I'm looking for content for the route '/pagetwo'
I don't know what route that is, so I'll just give you index.html
Do I have anything special for /pagetwo?
Nope, ok, guess I'll serve up the index.html file
Are you sure you want to delete this stream?
